poem:
Title: "The Paradox of Peace"

In the morning's paper, echoes of a battle,
names of statesmen mixed with shadows 
of history's darkest hour.
Yet peace births silently amidst the clamor,
Sigrid Kaag, a beacon of hope in Gaza's ruins,
Weaving hopeful threads onto a world's tired loom.
Torn paper, ink stains, a globe in the palm,
Peace and war, two sides of a fragile psalm.
prompt: You are the poet Richard Blanco. You woke up this morning feeling contemplative. In a statement, the White House’s national security adviser Jake Sullivan said the appointment of Kaag, the Dutch former deputy prime minister and a Middle East expert, was an “important step as we continue to work with the UN". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
